verse: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: In the land of Judah and in its towns, they will once again use these words when I restore their fortunes,
And in the land of Judah and all its towns, the farmers and those who care for the flocks will dwell together.
For I will provide the weary with all they need, and I will restore the strength of all those who have grown faint with hunger.
At this moment I awakened and looked around, and I realized that my sleep had been pleasant.
The days are coming, says the Lord, when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of men and the seed of animals.
And as I once watched over them to uproot and pull down, to demolish, destroy, and inflict disaster, so now I will watch over them to build and to plant, says the Lord.
In those days they will no longer say,
For each one will die for his own sins. The teeth of everyone who eats sour grapes will be set on edge.
The New Covenant. The days are coming, says the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah.

However, it will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand and brought them out of the land of Egypt, a covenant that they broke even though I was their master.

However, this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord. I will establish my law in their minds and inscribe it in their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

No longer will there be any need for them to teach one another, or to say to one another, “Know the Lord,” because they will all know me, says the Lord, from the least of them to the greatest. For I will forgive their iniquity and no longer remember their sin.
Jerusalem Rebuilt. The days are coming, says the Lord, when this city will be rebuilt for the Lord, from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
The measuring line will then be stretched from there straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn to Goah.

The entire valley, with its corpses and ashes, and all the fields sloping toward the Kidron Valley on the east as far as the corner of the Horse Gate, will be sacred to the Lord. Never again will that city be uprooted or destroyed.
